title: Kate Bosworth packs on the PDA with husband Michael Polish as they celebrate his 49th birthday
text:
They've been happily married for over six years after falling in love on the set of the cinematic adaptation of Big Sur in 2011.

And Kate Bosworth and Michael Polish looked like honeymooners while celebrating the director's 49th birthday at Disneyland in Anaheim, California, on Tuesday.

The actress, 36, shared a passionate kiss with her husband as they packed on the PDA in the middle of the theme park.

Happy birthday, indeed! Kate Bosworth and Michael Polish looked like honeymooners while celebrating the director's 49th birthday at Disneyland in Anaheim, California, on Tuesday

The I-Land star kept it casual in high-waist blue jeans, worn with a white tank top tucked in.

Kate accessorised her look with a tan belt bag and white trainers, finishing off the relaxed ensemble with a pair of sparkly Minnie Mouse ears over a black cap.

The actress wore her blonde tresses down and added a brush of neutral make-up, including a pretty pink lipstick.

Michael looked relaxed as he walked around the park with his wife and a Disney tour guide, before planting a huge kiss on Kate while riding the Space Mountain rollercoaster.

Pucker up: The actress, 36, shared a passionate kiss with her husband as they packed on the PDA while riding in the front row on Space Mountain

The film director wore light trousers with a white T-shirt and added a splash of colour with a scarf around his neck.

The movie-maker, who will turn 49 on October 30, also wore a cap but swapped his Mickey ears for a Disney birthday badge.

Kate typically keeps a low profile, but has been back in the spotlight after promoting her new Netflix series, the I-Land.

Kate and Michael - who has a daughter Jasper, 20, from his previous marriage - met when he directed her in a cinematic adaptation of Jack Kerouac's 1962 novel Big Sur in 2011.

Off-duty beauty: The I-Land star kept it casual in high-waist blue jeans, worn with a white tank top tucked in and playful Minnie Mouse ears

The couple tied the knot two years later in a romantic ceremony in Philipsburg, Montana, in August 2013.

Speaking in an interview with British Marie Claire magazine in January 2015, Kate admitted she was cautious about rushing into a relationship with her director while they were filming on set in California.

She explained: 'There are so many people that hook up on movies, and you wonder if that's real, so we didn't go there.

'I think we were both experienced to know that if this was the real deal, we could wait to see what would happen.'

Smile: Kate couldn't contain her happiness as Michael lifted her up for a picture as the couple enjoyed their fun day out

Getting involved: Michael and Kate embraced the Disney spirit, with the soon-to-be birthday boy even stopping to try and interact with some Stormtroopers

Having adopted a patient approach to her romance with the director, Kate admits it wasn't long before she discovered he was 'The One'.

She recalled: 'That's when it hit me, at about a million miles an hour – I almost fell off my chair. They always say, "You know when you know," and I had found that quite frustrating my whole life.

'I thought, "Yeah, but how do you really know?" But it's true – he walked in and it hit me, like nothing I'd ever felt before…

'Meeting Michael honestly felt like coming home. It feels comfortable and secure but also exciting.'
description: The couple looked as though they were still very much in the honeymoon period while celebrating the director's 49th birthday at  Disneyland in Anaheim, California, on Tuesday.
